meanings.definition: A shot in billiards in which the cue ball strikes two balls successively.
meanings.sent1: During the game of billiards, a skilled player can execute a precise carom to pocket multiple balls.
meanings.sent2: The player made a perfect carom, hitting the cue ball first, then the red ball, and finally the black ball.
meanings.sent3: In the billiards tournament, the unexpected carom shot left everyone amazed and cheering.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to carom off him, having no effect on his determined attitude.
meanings.sent5: The carom shot echoed through the billiards hall, showcasing the player's expertise.

meanings.sent1: The basketball caromed off the rim and back into play.
meanings.sent2: The ball caromed off the wall and landed in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's energy caused him to carom off the furniture in the room.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts seemed to carom from one idea to another, unable to focus on a single thought.
meanings.sent5: The caroming sound of the hammer hitting the metal echoed in the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The carom of the ball off the wall surprised the players on the field.
meanings.sent2: The carom of the bullet off the metal surface created a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The carom of the tennis ball off the net caught the opponent off guard.
meanings.sent4: The carom of the coin off the table landed it in an unexpected spot.
meanings.sent5: The carom of the stone off the water's surface created ripples in the pond.
